alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 1:02PM EDT until August 21 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL BOONE AND NORTH CENTRAL LOGAN COUNTIES... At 102 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain across the warned area earlier today. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rainfall earlier today. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, streets and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Madison, Chapmanville, Danville and Turtle Creek. Road closures from locally heavy rainfall earlier today continue impact the Danville area. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
